sen.j: 流祖片桐貞昌（貞昌）の長男片桐貞信（幼名鶴千代）が1000石の旗本に取り立てられ、下條を称し名を下條信隆にあらためておこした旗本の家系で七世片桐宗猿まで一子相伝で伝承される。
sen.e: It is a family line of hatamoto (direct retainer of the shogun) that started when Sadanobu KATAGIRI, who was called Tsuruchiyo in childhood and was the oldest son of Sadamasa KATAGIRI, the initiator of the school, was patronized by hatamoto of 1,000 koku (approximately 180 thousand liters of crop yield), and changed his name to Nobutaka SHIMOJO; It had since been inherited to Soen KATAGIRI in the seventh generation from father to only one child.

sen.e: The group has the lineage of Hatamoto (direct retainer of the shogun), since Sadanobu KATAGIRI (Tsuruchiyo in childhood) who was the oldest son of Sadamasa KATAGIRI, the founder of the school, was appointed to Hatamoto of 1,000 koku (approximately 180 thousand liters of crop yield) and called himself Nobutaka SHIMOJO, and had been inherited to the seventh head, Soen KATAGIRI, from father to only one child.

sen.j: 昭和初期までただ石州流と称していたが、石州系他派と区別するため七世の信方の茶号宗猿より流派名をとり石州流茶道宗猿系（せきしゅうりゅうちゃどうそうえんけい）と称している。
sen.e: It had been called just Sekishu-ryu until the early Showa period, but to distinguish itself from other schools of Sekishu-ryu, it took its name from the title of Nobukata in the seventh generation, Soen, and changed its name to Sekishu-ryu chado Soen kei (Japanese tea ceremony Soen-kei group of Sekishu school).

sen.j: 九世磯貝宗和の門人より石州流片桐宗猿派が分派している。
sen.e: Soen KATAGIRI's group of Sekishu school was started out by disciples of Sowa ISOGAI in the ninth generation.
